pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the Select and Speak Chrome extension, its purpose, core functionality, and key features

pages.title: Architecture
pages.purpose: Explain the high-level system architecture, component relationships, communication patterns, and execution contexts

pages.title: Background Service Worker
pages.purpose: Deep dive into background.js - the core TTS orchestration system, speech state management, message handling, and event coordination

pages.title: Message Protocol and Communication
pages.purpose: Explain the message passing system, ACTIONS protocol, and how the background worker communicates with content scripts

pages.title: Configuration System
pages.purpose: Explain constants.js - the shared configuration, default settings, action types, and how it's used across all components

pages.title: Content Script
pages.purpose: Deep dive into content.js - text selection detection, DOM manipulation, visual feedback, and web page integration

pages.title: Text Selection Detection
pages.purpose: Explain how the content script detects user text selections, handles mouse and keyboard events, and validates selections

pages.title: Visual Feedback System
pages.purpose: Detailed explanation of the highlighting system, progress indicators, popup display, and DOM element injection

pages.title: Color Accessibility
pages.purpose: Explain the color contrast calculation system, WCAG compliance, and dynamic text color selection

pages.title: Settings Popup Interface
pages.purpose: Overview of the popup UI - its structure, behavior, and how users configure the extension

pages.title: UI Structure and Behavior
pages.purpose: Explain popup.html and popup.js - the DOM structure, event handlers, settings persistence, and user interactions

pages.title: Visual Design and Styling
pages.purpose: Explain popup.css - the component styling, theme system, and visual design patterns

pages.title: Extension Configuration
pages.purpose: Explain manifest.json, permissions, content script injection, and the extension's requirements and capabilities

pages.title: Visual Assets
pages.purpose: Document the icon files, their purposes, and usage in different contexts
